content.description: This is an enjoyable wide crack with plentiful face features that can be easily top-roped from anchors.
content.location:
Obvious wide crack between

Harlan Pepper

and

As the Crow Flies

.

climbs.name: Under the Influence
climbs.fa: Eric Odenthal and Ryan Scherler, June 2001

content.description:
Climbs a technical slab to large roof with the crux pulling over the lip on poor holds; easier climbing above the roof leads to anchors.

A 5.11b toprope variation has been done -

Around the Influence

.
content.location:
Slab to prominent roof between

Hubert

and

Butch the Bitch

.

content.description: Dive into a deep chimney and slither upwards past a chock stone midway, then upwards following a hand crack and some easy face climbing to shared anchors.
content.protection:
Gear to 4 inches, shared anchors with

As the Crow Flies
content.location:
Wide crack just right of

As the Crow Flies

.

content.description:
Undercling up a ramp to clip the first bolt, then head up to a ledge and clip the second bolt (bit of a reach if you're short). Steep and thin climbing leads to the third bolt, then it eases up to a crossover to the right and over the crack (1" cam here if you like), the forth bolt is just ahead and from there it's a fun cruise on plates to the chain anchors.

Beautiful rock.
content.protection: Four bolts and an optional 1" cam.

content.description:
Takes the broken crack line to the right of the roof. The crux is negotiating the steep off width crack at the finish.

Ends on a great ledge which shares anchor with

Under the Influence

(5.12c).
content.protection: Small varied rack of cams to 4".
content.location: Crack to the right of the third buttress from the left, just right of the huge roof.

content.description:
Up and onto a big hold at the bottom of the face (first bolt). Tenuously now past 2 more bolts, with nice moves on great rock up to the crux, trend slightly right to the horizontal break (cam if you want), up onto the break and finish the slab above (bolt), then step left and finish up Harlan Pepper to its anchors.

At bolt number three it's possible to use good holds on the left to bypass the crux, this reduces the grade to 5.8.
content.protection: Four bolts and an optional 1" cam.
content.location: Face up the second buttress from the left.

content.description:
Climb the initial slab of

Under the Influence

about three-quarters of the way, then break left to the arete, pull the roof and finish on featured face.
content.location:
Just left of

Under the Influence

with a common start.
